question: Where is the DMD gene located?
ideal_answer: The dystrophin gene (DMD) is located on the X chromosome (Xp21).

snippets.text: The dystrophin gene (DMD) is the largest gene in the human genome, mapping on the Xp21 chromosome locus.
Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) and Becker muscular dystrophy (BMD) are X-linked recessive disorders caused by mutations of the DMD gene located at Xp21.
The disease is caused by deletion, duplication or point mutation of the dystrophin gene, located on the X chromosome (Xp21).

Dystrophinopathies are allelic conditions caused by deletions, duplications and point-mutations in the DMD gene, located on the X chromosome (Xp21.2).
The disease is caused by mutations in the DMD gene located on the X chromosome.
